sub_title: Health and Clinical Psychology Research Masters at Leiden University
summary:
Hi everyone, I am a 24-year-old part-time student currently pursuing a Health and Clinical Psychology Research Masters degree at Leiden University in the Netherlands. Prior to this, I completed my International Bachelor's degree in Psychology at the same institution. I also completed my International Baccalaureate at the International School of the Stockholm Region in Sweden.

In terms of work experience, I have been fortunate enough to gain a range of diverse experiences. Most recently, I worked as an Education Manager for Queer Leiden University, where I helped build a manual of resources that are Trans- and Non-binary friendly. In January 2022, I worked at Karolinska Hospital A05 Diagnostics in Stockholm, where I was responsible for packing corona test kits to send to big corporations around Sweden.

I have also worked as a Substitute Teacher at Dibber International School, where I taught Spanish, English, Swedish, and Social sciences, as well as planned and implemented anti-bullying courses in classes of children between 11-14 of age.

In addition to my academic and professional pursuits, I have a diverse range of personal interests that reflect my passion for learning and growth. Lately, I have been delving into the world of third wave therapies and eastern medical approaches to healing, as well as exploring Buddhist philosophy and end-of-life practices. I am also deeply interested in the psychology of palliative care and its impact on individuals and families. As an advocate for LGBTQ causes and sexology, I believe in the importance of promoting understanding and acceptance in all areas of life. These varied interests reflect my desire to constantly expand my knowledge and engage with different perspectives.

I would describe myself as an ambitious and fast-learning person who enjoys learning new things and expanding my areas of knowledge. I am always looking for opportunities to grow and support others' growth. I enjoy talking to people, exchanging ideas, and executing them. Thank you for taking the time to read my overview, and please feel free to connect with me if you would like to learn more.

profile_positions.description: As the Vice President of Queer Leiden University, my mission is to foster effective communication, enhance team cooperation, and create a comprehensive overview of our work to secure funding for our initiatives. Building upon my previous experience as an Educational Manager, my focus now extends to improving internal and external communication channels, promoting collaboration among faculty, staff, and students, and streamlining processes to ensure efficient operations.
profile_positions.title: Vice President

profile_positions.description: My job consisted in creating a manual for LGBTQ+ individuals arriving in the Netherlands, my focus is on facilitating access to healthcare. I provide guidance on mental health resources and identify Trans- and Non-binary friendly options, ensuring that individuals from diverse backgrounds can receive appropriate care.
profile_positions.title: Educational Manager

profile_positions.description: As a content editor, I am responsible for crafting and editing compelling programs that promote our company's services and events. My goal is to connect the content of our workshops to psychology and make them more accessible to underrepresented communities, such as the LGBTQ+ community. I am proud to play a part in creating content that not only informs but also empowers individuals to take control of their mental health and wellbeing.
profile_positions.title: Psychology Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: As a Fundraiser, Event Planner, and Advertising specialist at the Swedish Indian Embassy, I was responsible for planning and executing international fundraising events that aimed to raise awareness about business cooperation opportunities between Sweden and India, in collaboration with the Indian embassy.

As a fundraiser and builder, my responsibilities with my school included overseeing a toilet building project for a neighboring village, developing innovative fundraising strategies, and organizing presentations to raise awareness about our cause.

company.name: C.A.R.E. The center of animal rehabilitation and Education

volunteer_experiences.description: As a volunteer at a wildlife sanctuary, I gained valuable experience in sustainability and animal care. My responsibilities included nursing infant baboons, conducting data collection and field research in the African bush, and maintaining clean and organized baboon troop enclosures. Additionally, I took on the initiative to improve and develop the baboon and volunteer facilities. This experience is one that I cherish and continue to draw upon in my personal and professional life.
